Floating Water Purification Systems: Design and deploy floating water purification systems that can be placed on lakes, rivers, or other bodies of water in developing countries. These systems would use a combination of ultraviolet light, ceramic filters, and other technologies to remove bacteria, viruses, and other contaminants from the water. This approach would provide clean water to communities that are located near water sources but lack access to safe drinking water.

Community-Led Rainwater Harvesting: Establish a community-led rainwater harvesting program that encourages households to install rainwater collection systems in their homes. The program would provide training and support to households on how to maintain and repair their systems, as well as educate them on the importance of proper storage and treatment of rainwater. This approach would provide clean water to communities that lack access to safe drinking water due to conflict, natural disasters, or other crises.
